Comment: I've never navigated the disability system myself but it seems incredibly backlogged, like it takes a very long time, and you end up with healthcare coverage in addition to a stipend anyway. So I don't understand why people who are able to work should jump through all the hoops to cost us as taxpayers more money in the end when it is literally cheaper and way more streamlined to just pay for the medical care they need to get working to begin with.   Average processing time for disability, including partial is 232 days. Federal law requires a state to make a medicaid decision within 45 days. It would honestly have been terrible if I was forced to go through the disability system rather than the medicaid system. I'm forever thankful I had that option, tbh.    I understand your point about people mooching off the system, I just find this to be an imperfect solution that might not meaningfully help the situation and could end up pigeon-holing people into relying on the system more than they actually have to. If the work requirement gradually kicked in (like if you're going to rely on it for the long term, it might be a bit more palatable from my perspective, honestly.) I personally don't think healthcare should be tied to employment at all, but that's where the ACA has some ability to bridge the gap.
